revised_title: Equation of State for Gases at High Densities and Temperatures
tldr: The authors propose a simple model for a gas at high density and temperature, using a cell model to calculate the energy of each molecule as a function of cell volume. They apply this model to the hydrodynamic theory of detonation, discussing the equation of state for gases at high density and temperature, relevant to the detonation wave in condensed explosives. The model is tested using pentaerythritol tetranitrate, with results in good agreement with experimental data.
